content:
You can add the Uniqlo purchase to the table. Here's the updated table:

**Online Spending Tracker**

| Date | Category | Description | Amount | Total | Category Total | Month |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1/15/2023 | Clothing | Zappos boots | $ [insert amount] | $ [insert total] | $ [insert category total] | January |
| 1/20/2023 | Clothing | Nike sneakers | $ [insert amount] | $ [insert total] | $ [insert category total] | January |
| 1/25/2023 | Clothing | Uniqlo sweaters | $ [insert amount] | $ [insert total] | $ [insert category total] | January |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |  |

Just fill in the amount for the Uniqlo sweaters, and update the totals accordingly.

As you continue to add more purchases, you might want to consider using formulas to calculate the totals automatically. For example, you can use the `SUM` function to calculate the total amount spent in the "Total" column.

If you need help with formulas or have any other questions, feel free to ask!

By the way, it's great that you're keeping track of your online spending. This will help you stay on top of your finances and make more informed purchasing decisions in the future.
